messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
My friend has been missing since 7 o'clock this morning. She's in the middle of a divorce, and I'm not sure what to do.
Can you give me some more details about why you believe she's missing?
She supposedly went for a run this morning at 7 o'clock in Lockmere, but no one has heard from her. She was supposed to be at my house at 8, and she never showed up.
Have you checked with any local hospitals or anyone she might have contacted?
I called Wake Med, and they haven't admitted her on any emergent basis.
Okay. Just a moment. May I place you on hold for just a moment?
Yep.
Thank you. That's correct. All right. What is your friend's name?
Her name is Nancy Cooper.
What is her address?
She and her husband live together, but they are in the middle of a divorce.
Have you tried making contact with her?
Yes, I called her husband this morning around 9. He said she went for a run with her friend Carrie, but she hasn't returned. I'm worried because it's not like her to disappear like this.
Has her husband been violent with her in the past?
I'm not sure if he's been physically violent, but I know there's been a lot of tension.
Is it possible she might have done something else and just forgotten to inform anyone?
Her car is parked at home and her cell phone is there, so it seems like she did leave for a run. It's not like her to just vanish without letting anyone know.
Did her husband mention anything about her running with someone else?
Yes, he said she was running with a friend named Carrie, but none of her other friends or I knew anything about it. It's very odd.
What can the police department do to help in this situation?
I'm not sure what to do. Should her husband be the one to file a report? Is there a certain number of hours we need to wait?
There is no time limit to file a missing person report. The person who last saw her should file it, which in this case would be her husband.
Okay. I'm just worried about how her husband will react.
It's better to be safe than sorry. We will send an officer to her house to speak with her husband and check the area.
Thank you. Her husband contacted me directly to explain the situation.
We will also check the trails around Lockmere Lake. Can you describe the trails she might have taken?
Yes, they're public trails, but some parts are more secluded. I've run with her there before.
Alright, give us about 30 to 45 minutes to work on this. You can call me back after that.
Okay. My name is Michelle.
Thank you, Michelle. We'll do everything we can.
Thank you. Bye.
Goodbye.
